p: Figure 1b shows similar results to Fig. 1a, but with data for individual species within one year and one country pooled. Figure 1c shows the same as Fig. 1b, but with data for trees excluded. Not surprisingly, in both Fig. 1b,c, single factor ANOVA also revealed significant differences between the three datasets (F = 12.74, p < 0.05; F = 9.27, p < 0.05) and the subsequent Tukey HSD test revealed that colony duration in the Czech Republic in 2019 was significantly shorter than in Greece in both 2017 and 2018, while there was no significant difference between colony duration in 2017 and 2018 in Greece.
